#define Topical_DIL_Files_Updated_Access (  Here,
There,
ThereSteps    ) 
 

Value:

if (updated) { \
                Protected_Linked_List_Indexed_Access(Topical_DIL_Files,Here,There); \
        } \
        if (!Prev()) { \
                if (Refresh()) return ThereSteps(n); \
                else return NULL; \
        } else { \
                Invalidate(); \
                return Prev()->ThereSteps(n+1); \
        }

String absurl (  String    srcurl,
String    relurl
) 
 

Definition at line 1943 of file utilities.cc.

References String::after(), String::before(), String::contains(), String::freq(), and String::gsub().

Referenced by extract_paper_plan_to_paper(), extract_recursively(), generate_modify_element_FORM_interface_DIL_entry_content(), Detailed_Items_List::Get_All_DIL_ID_File_Parameters(), get_Paper_Plans_Section_IDs(), modify_element_through_FORM_interface(), and Topical_DIL_Files::Refresh(). 

01943                                             {
01944 // srcurl is an absolute filename or a directory path
01945 // ending with "/"
01946 // relurl is a URL relative to srcurl or an absolute URL
01947 // Note: This function may be confused by directory names
01948 //       of the form BigRegex(".+[.][.]")
01949         if (relurl=="") return srcurl;
01950         if (relurl.contains("://")) relurl = relurl.after("://");
01951         if (relurl[0]=='/') return relurl;
01952         if (relurl[0]=='#') return srcurl+relurl;
01953         int upcnt = relurl.freq("../");
01954         relurl.gsub("../","");
01955         srcurl = srcurl.before('/',-1); // prune source filename
01956         for (int i = 0; i < upcnt; i++) srcurl = srcurl.before('/',-1);
01957         return srcurl+'/'+relurl;
01958 }

00037                 // make Task Log entry
00038                 if (!make_note()) EOUT << "dil2al: Unable to make note in chunk_contorller(), continuing as is\n";
00039                 madenote = true;
00040         }
00041         // offer controller options
00042         lbuf[0]='\0'; String chunkid;
00043         while (lbuf[0]=='\0') {
00044                 String message = "\nOptions:\n[C]ontinue Task Chunk if Time Remaining else Start New Task Chunk\n";
00045                 if (!chunkcreated) message += "[S]tart New Task Chunk (new task context)\n";
00046                 message += "S[t]op Task Chunk (pause list tasks)\nE[x]it Retaining Current State (ignore list suggestions)\n";
00047                 if (useansi) cout << ANSI_BOLD_ON; // bold on
00048                 auto_interactive(controllercmd,message,lbuf,LLEN);
00049                 if (useansi) cout << ANSI_BOLD_OFF; // bold off
00050                 // refresh curtime to avoid misrepresentations due to long delay before option selection
00051                 // but don't change time if madenote to properly detect chunkid==curtime
00052                 // if a new chunk was made during make_note()
00053                 if (!madenote) curtime = time_stamp("%Y%m%d%H%M");
00054                 String tl; int tlinsertloc;
00055                 switch (lbuf[0]) {
00056                         case 'c': case 'C':
00057                                 if (verbose) VOUT << "Continuing according to task list chunk controller suggestions\n";
00058                                 tlinsertloc = -1;
00059                                 if (!read_file_into_String(get_TL_head(),tl)) return String("");
00060                                 if (tl=="") return tl;
00061                                 if ((chunkid=decide_add_TL_chunk(tl,tlinsertloc,true,false))=="") return String("");
00062                                 break;
00063                         case 's': case 'S':
00064                                 if (!chunkcreated) {
00065                                         if (verbose) VOUT << "Starting task chunk with new context\n";
00066                                         tlinsertloc = -1;
00067                                         if (!read_file_into_String(get_TL_head(),tl)) return String("");
00068                                         if (tl=="") return tl;
00069                                         if ((chunkid=decide_add_TL_chunk(tl,tlinsertloc,false,false))=="") return String("");
00070                                 } else {
00071                                         EOUT << "dil2al: Unknown option `" << lbuf[0] << "'\n";
00072                                         lbuf[0]='\0';
00073                                 }
00074                                 break;
00075                         case 't': case 'T':
00076 //*** instead of this approach, which exits once list tasks are paused
00077 //*** it is possible to stay in this while loop and offer exit as well
00078 //*** as start with comparetimes=false in the decide_add_TL_chunk() call
00079                                 if (verbose) VOUT << "Stopping task chunk and pausing list tasks\n";
00080                                 if (!read_file_into_String(get_TL_head(),tl)) return String("");
00081                                 if (tl=="") return tl;
00082                                 stop_TL_chunk(tl);
00083                                 if (!write_file_from_String(taskloghead,tl,"Task Log")) return String("");
00084                                 chunkid = "-1";
00085                                 break;
00086                         case 'x': case 'X':
00087                                 if (verbose) VOUT << "Exiting and retaining current task state\n";
00088                                 chunkid = "-2";
00089                                 break;
00090                         default:
00091                                 EOUT << "dil2al: Unknown option `" << lbuf[0] << "'\n";
00092                                 lbuf[0] = '\0';
00093                 }
00094         }
00095         return chunkid;
00096 }

00675         //      - remove Novelty Marker tags

00690         itemcontent.gsub(BigRegex("[<]!--[      ]*chunk End[    ]*--[>][        ]*[<][Ii][>][^<]+[<]/[Ii][>]"),"");

00694         itemcontent.gsub(BigRegex("[<]\\([Ii]\\|[Ee][Mm]\\)[>]"),"{\\em ");

00702         itemcontent.gsub("&amp;","\\&");

int copy_until_line (  ifstream *    lf,
ofstream *    of,
const char *    pattern,
char *    lbuf,
int    llen
)

02248                                                                                                {
02249 // returns 1 if line was encountered, 0 if not, and <0 for errors
02250 // the line containing pattern is not copied, but is returned in lbuf
02251         regex_t re;
02252         int mres;
02253         if (!lf) {
02254                 EOUT << "dil2al: input file not open in copy_until_line()\n";
02255                 return -1;
02256         }
02257         if (!of) {
02258                 EOUT << "dil2al: output file not open in copy_until_line()\n";
02259                 return -1;
02260         }
02261         if (regcomp(&re,pattern, REG_EXTENDED|REG_NOSUB) != 0) {
02262                 EOUT << "dil2al: Unable to compile regular expression in copy_until_line()\n";
02263                 return -2;
02264         }
02265         mres = 1;
02266         cout << "dil2al WARNING: copy_until_line(<from>,<to>," << pattern << ",<lbuf>,<llen>) may be broken as EOF is not detected when line length exceeds llen=" << llen << ", this code should use BigRegex functions instead!\n";
02267         while (mres!=0) {
02268                 if (lf->eof()) {
02269                         regfree(&re);
02270                         return 0;
02271                 }
02272                 lf->getline(lbuf,llen);
02273                 mres = regexec(&re,lbuf, (size_t) 0, NULL, 0);
02274                 if ((mres != 0) && (mres != REG_NOMATCH)) {
02275                         EOUT << "dil2al: Internal error while matching in copy_until_line()\n";
02276                         regfree(&re);
02277                         return -3;
02278                 }
02279                 if (mres!=0) (*of) << lbuf << endl;
02280         }
02281         regfree(&re);
02282         return 1;
02283 }

int &    tlinsertloc,
bool    comparetimes,
bool    createifgreater = true
) 
 

Definition at line 971 of file tladmin.cc.

Referenced by chunk_controller(), and process_note_TL(). 

00971                                                                                                            {
00972 // Add a Task Log chunk based on strategies and time since creation
00973 // of most recent chunk
00974 // time-based decisions can be either
00975 // create-if-greater-than-chunksize-plus-slack or
00976 // create-unless-smaller-than-chunksize
00977 // initialize tlinsertloc with -1 to search from end of Task Log
00978 // tlinsertloc is updated for use when adding entry to Task Log
00979 // returns chunkid
00980         // find most recent TL chunk (immediately preceding @INSERT-TL-NOTE@ if present)
00981         const int LLEN = 10240;
00982         char lbuf[LLEN];
00983         String chunkid; bool newchunk = !createifgreater;
00984         if ((tlinsertloc = locate_most_recent_TL_chunk(tl,tlinsertloc,&chunkid))<0) return String("");
00985         if (chunkid=="") newchunk=true;
00986         else {
00987                 // compare chunk time stamp with curtime
00988 #ifdef DEBUG
00989                 cout << "decision chunkid = " << chunkid << "\ncurtime = " << curtime << '\n';
00990 #endif
00991                 if (createifgreater) {
00992                         // test if curtime > chunk_creation_time+timechunksize+timechunkslack
00993                         if ((comparetimes) && ((time_stamp_diff(chunkid,curtime)/60)>(timechunksize+timechunkslack))) {
00994                                 if (timechunkoverstrategy==TCS_NEW) newchunk=true;
00995                                 else if (timechunkoverstrategy==TCS_ASK) {
00996                                         if (useansi) cout << ANSI_BOLD_ON; // bold on
00997                                         cout << "\nDifference between time stamp of current Task Log chunk and current time is\ngreater than " << (timechunksize+timechunkslack) << " minutes. Create new Task Log chunk? (y/N) ";
00998                                         if (useansi) cout << ANSI_BOLD_OFF; // bold off
00999                                         cin.getline(lbuf,LLEN);
01000                                         if ((lbuf[0]=='y') || (lbuf[0]=='Y')) newchunk=true;
01001                                 }
01002                         }
01003                 } else {
01004                         // test if curtime == chunk_creation_time, e.g. created during make_note() opportunity in chunk_controller()
01005                         if (chunkid==curtime) newchunk=false;
01006                         else {
01007                                 // test if curtime < chunk_creation_time+timechunksize
01008                                 if ((comparetimes) && ((time_stamp_diff(chunkid,curtime)/60)<timechunksize)) {
01009                                         if (timechunkunderstrategy==TCS_CURRENT) newchunk=false;
01010                                         else if (timechunkunderstrategy==TCS_ASK) {
01011                                                 if (useansi) cout << ANSI_BOLD_ON; // bold on
01012                                                 cout << "\nDifference between time stamp of current Task Log chunk and current time is\nless than " << timechunksize << " minutes. Create new Task Log chunk anyway? (y/N) ";
01013                                                 if (useansi) cout << ANSI_BOLD_OFF; // bold off
01014                                                 cin.getline(lbuf,LLEN);
01015                                                 if ((lbuf[0]!='y') && (lbuf[0]!='Y')) newchunk=false;
01016                                         }
01017                                 }
01018                         }
01019                 }
01020         }
01021         if (newchunk) {
01022                 bool newsection = false;
01023                 // if TL contains more than sectionsize chunks consider starting a new section
01024                 int numchunks = BigRegex_freq(tl,"[<]!--[       ]+chunk Begin[  ]+--[>]");
01025                 if (numchunks>=sectionsize) {
01026                         if (sectionstrategy==TSS_NEW) newsection = true;
01027                         else if (sectionstrategy==TSS_ASK) {
01028                                 if (useansi) cout << ANSI_BOLD_ON; // bold on
01029                                 cout << "\nThere are " << numchunks << " chunks in this Task Log section. Create new section? (y/N) ";
01030                                 if (useansi) cout << ANSI_BOLD_OFF; // bold off
01031                                 cin.getline(lbuf,LLEN);
01032                                 if ((lbuf[0]=='y') || (lbuf[0]=='Y')) newsection=true;
01033                         }
01034                 }
01035                 if (newsection) {
01036                         // add a new section to the Task Log
01037                         if (!add_TL_section(tl)) {
01038                                 EOUT << "dil2al: Unable to add new Task Log section in decide_add_TL_chunk()\n";
01039                                 return String("");
01040                         }
01041                 }
01042                 // add a new chunk to the Task Log
01043                 if ((chunkid = add_TL_chunk_or_entry(tl,chunkid,true,chunkid,tlinsertloc))=="") {
01044                         EOUT << "dil2al: Unable to add new Task Log chunk in decide_add_TL_chunk()\n";
01045                         return String("");
01046                 }
01047         }
01048         return chunkid;
01049 }

int DIL_entry_target_date_qsort_compare (  const void *    vde1,
const void *    vde2
) 
 

Definition at line 1774 of file utilities.cc.

References MAXTIME_T.

Referenced by Detailed_Items_List::Sort_by_Target_Date(). 

01774                                                                               {
01775 // used with qsort() (<stdlib.h>)
01776 // Treats unspecified self-referential target dates as MAXTIME
01777 // for the ordering of the corresponding DIL entry  - and avoids
01778 // the accompanying warning messages.
01779 // (This is useful when groups of DIL entries with desired
01780 // target dates are sorted, in which some DIL entries are marked
01781 // with -2 codes).
01782 // Note: ISO C++ is strict about providing the correct function
01783 // declaration in cases such as the call to qsort(). This function
01784 // was therefore rewritten from the original declaration,
01785 // DIL_entry_target_date_qsort_compare(DIL_entry ** de1, DIL_entry ** de2)
01786 // - please keep in mind that the elements are of type DIL_entry **,
01787 // i.e. arrays/pointers of pointers to objects.
01788         DIL_entry ** de1 = (DIL_entry **) vde1;
01789         DIL_entry ** de2 = (DIL_entry **) vde2;
01790         time_t t1 = MAXTIME_T, t2 = MAXTIME_T;
01791         if (*de1) t1 = (*de1)->Propagated_Target_Date(false);
01792         if (*de2) t2 = (*de2)->Propagated_Target_Date(false);
01793         if (t1==t2) return 0;
01794         if (t1<t2) return -1;
01795         return 1;
01796 }

00274 // returns an array with the number of task chunks
00275 // required to complete the DIL entries in the array
00276 // dep with length deplen
00277   long * req = new long[deplen];
00278   float completion;
00279   long c_size = ((long) timechunksize)*60;
00280   for (int i=0; i<deplen; i++) {
00281     req[i] = dep[i]->Time_Required();
00282     completion = dep[i]->Completion_State();
00283     if (completion<0.0) completion = 1.0; // negative completion values have special meaning but do imply that the task is no longer scheduled to be completed
00284     if (completion>1.0) {
00285       EOUT << "dil2al: Completion ratio exceeds 1.0 for DIL#";
00286       if (calledbyforminput) EOUT << "<A HREF=\"" << idfile << '#' << dep[i]->chars() << "\">";
00287       EOUT << dep[i]->chars();
00288       if (calledbyforminput) EOUT << "</A>";
00289       EOUT << " in DIL_Required_Task_Chunks(), continuing\n";
00290       req[i] = 0;
00291       continue;
00292     }
00293     completion = ceil(((double) req[i])*(1.0-completion)); // determine remaining time required
00294     req[i] = (long) completion;
00295     if (req[i] % c_size) req[i] = (req[i]/c_size) + 1;
00296     else req[i] /= c_size;
00297   }
00298   return req;
00299 }

01163         cout << 'K'; cout.flush();

01165         include_article_tail_template(pout,ostrtext,pprevtext);
01166         // add FIGURE CAPTIONS and FIGURE PSCONVERSIONS sections if present
01167         if (figcaps!=NULL) ostrtext.gsub(BigRegex("@Begin FIGURE CAPTIONS@[^\n]*\n"),"@Begin FIGURE CAPTIONS@\n"+_figcaps);
01168         if (figps!=NULL) ostrtext.gsub(BigRegex("@Begin FIGURE PSCONVERSIONS@[^\n]*\n"),"@Begin FIGURE PSCONVERSIONS@\n"+_figps);
01169         // add \figureloose commands
01170         int ofigidx;
01171         if ((ofigidx = ostrtext.index(fighererx))>=0) {
01172                 // find loose figures location in outline and copy to there
01173                 int iloosefigidx, ifigend; String ostrtail;
01174                 if (((iloosefigidx = ostrtext.index(BigRegex("\n%[      ]*@Begin FIGURES AT END@"),-1))>=0)
01175                  && ((ifigend = ostrtext.index(BigRegex("\n%[   ]*@End FIGURES AT END@[^\n]*\n"),String::SEARCH_END,-1))>=0)) {
01176                         ostrtail = ostrtext.from(ifigend);
01177                         ostrtext = ostrtext.before(iloosefigidx);
01178                 } else {
01179                         if ((iloosefigidx = ostrtext.index("\\end{document}",-1))>=0) {
01180                                 ostrtail = ostrtext.from(iloosefigidx);
01181                                 ostrtext = ostrtext.before(iloosefigidx);
01182                         } else {
01183                                 EOUT << "dil2al: No \\end{document} found in outline in extract_paper_plan_to_paper(), continuing as is\n";
01184                                 ostrtail = "";
01185                         }
01186                 }
01187                 // copy \figurehere data to \figureloose commands
01188                 ostrtext += "\n% @Begin FIGURES AT END@\n\n";

01190                         String figdata;
01191                         if ((ifigend=TeX_get_command(ostrtext,ofigidx,figdata))>=0) {
01192                                 figdata.gsub(BigRegex("^\\([\\][A-Za-z]*\\)figurehere[{]"),"_1figureloose{",'_');
01193                                 ostrtext += figdata + "\n\n";
01194                         } else {
01195                                 EOUT << "dil2al: Incomplete figure command found for " << ostrtext.sub(fighererx,0) << " in extract_paper_plan_to_paper(), continuing as is\n";
01196                                 ifigend = ofigidx+1;
01197                         }
01198                         ofigidx = ostrtext.index(fighererx,ifigend);
01199                 }
01200                 ostrtext += "% @End FIGURES AT END@\n"+ostrtail;
01201         }
01202         // include protected text
01203         include_protected_text(ostrtext,pprevtext);
01204         // TeX format corrections, safeguards for TeX compilation
01205         TeX_format_corrections(ostrtext,true);

01207 cerr << "Add automatic call to add Context items to contexts file here (DIL#20010412121145.1)...\n";
01208         ostr << ostrtext; // write paper draft file
01209         ostr.close();
01210 #ifndef DEBUG_DO_NOT_CREATE_NEW_OUTLINE
01211         if (!backup_and_rename(pout,"Paper Draft")) return false;
01212         // find required items list in paper plan, create if not found
01213         if (requireditems.length()>0) {
01214                 int riidx;
01215                 if ((riidx = pptext.index(BigRegex("[<]!--[     ]*@Begin REQUIRED ITEMS@[       ]*--[>]\n"),String::SEARCH_END))<0) {
01216                         // create list of required items
01217                         if ((riidx = pptext.index(BigRegex("\\([<][Pp][>][      ]*\n[<][Hh][Rr][>].*\\)?[<]/[Bb][Oo][Dd][Yy][>]")))<0)
01218                                 EOUT << "dil2al: Unable to create list of required items in extract_paper_plan_to_paper(), continuing as is\n";
01219                         else {
01220                                 String pptextrest = pptext.at(riidx,pptext.length()-riidx);
01221                                 pptext = pptext.before(riidx)
01222                                                 + "<H2><A HNAME=\"required-items\">Required Items</A></H2>\n\n<UL>\n<!-- @Begin REQUIRED ITEMS@ -->\n<!-- @End REQUIRED ITEMS@ -->\n</UL>\n\n"
01223                                                 + pptextrest;
01224                                 riidx += 92; // move index to start of <!-- @End REQUIRED ITEMS@ --> tag
01225                         }
01226                 }
01227                 if (riidx>=0) {
01228                         // update required items list
01229                         int riend;
01230                         if ((riend = pptext.index(BigRegex("[<]!--[     ]*@End REQUIRED ITEMS@[         ]*--[>]"),riidx))<0) {
01231                                 EOUT << "dil2al: Missing @End REQUIRED ITEMS@ tag in extract_paper_plan_to_paper(), placing tag\n";
01232                                 String pptextrest = pptext.at(riidx,pptext.length()-riidx);
01233                                 pptext = pptext.before(riidx) + "<!-- @End REQUIRED ITEMS@ -->\n" + pptextrest;
01234                                 riend = riidx;
01235                         }
01236                         String pptextrest = pptext.at(riend,pptext.length()-riend);
01237                         pptext = pptext.before(riidx) + requireditems + pptextrest;
01238                         // store, backup and rename updated paper plan
01239                         ostr.open(ppname+".new");
01240                         if (!ostr) {
01241                                 EOUT << "dil2al: Unable to create " << ppname << ".new to update required items list in extract_paper_plan_to_paper(), continuing as is\n";
01242                                 return false;
01243                         }
01244                         ostr << pptext;
01245                         if (!backup_and_rename(ppname,"Paper Plan"))
01246                                 EOUT << "dil2al: Unable to update required items list extract_paper_plan_to_paper(), continuing as is\n";
01247                 }
01248         } else if (verbose) VOUT << "No Required items to list\n";
01249         return true;
01250 #endif
01251 }

int find_in_line (  ifstream *    lf,
const char *    pattern,
int    nsub,

char *    lbuf,

)

References EOUT.

Referenced by add_new_to_DIL(), get_active_DIL_IDs(), and select_TL_AL_refs(). 

02285                                                                                                                             {
02286 // takes an open ifstream and searches for the regex pattern with nsub subexpressions
02287 // before a line with the ``before'' pattern (NULL = EOF)
02288 // returns substrings in dilid and the return value
02289 // 1 (found ``pattern''), 0 (found ``before''), -1 (EOF),
02290 // -2 (wrong #substrings), -3 (regex error) -4 (file not open)
02291         const int SLEN = 1024;
02292         char sbuf[SLEN];
02293         regex_t re,be;
02294         regmatch_t * rm;
02295         int mres;
02296         bool done;
02297         if (*lf) {
02298                 if (nsub) rm = new regmatch_t[nsub];
02299                 else rm = NULL;
02300                 if (regcomp(&re,pattern, REG_EXTENDED) != 0) {
02301                         EOUT << "dil2al: Unable to compile ``pattern'' regular expression in find_in_line()\n";
02302                         return -3;
02303                 }
02304                 if (before) {
02305                         if (regcomp(&be,before, REG_EXTENDED|REG_NOSUB) != 0) {
02306                                 regfree(&re);
02307                                 EOUT << "dil2al: Unable to compile ``before'' regular expression in find_in_line()\n";
02308                                 return -3;
02309                         }
02310                 }
02311                 done = false;
02312                 while (!done) {
02313                         if (lf->eof()) { mres = 2; done=true; }
02314                         else {
02315                                 lf->getline(lbuf,llen);
02316                                 if (before) mres = regexec(&be,lbuf, (size_t) 0, NULL, 0);
02317                                 if ((before) && (mres != 0) && (mres != REG_NOMATCH)) {
02318                                         EOUT << "dil2al: Internal error while matching ``before'' in find_in_line()\n";
02319                                         mres = 4; done = true;
02320                                 } else {
02321                                         if ((before) && (mres==0)) { mres = 1; done = true; }
02322                                         else {
02323                                                 mres = regexec(&re,lbuf, (size_t) nsub, rm, 0);
02324                                                 if ((mres != 0) && (mres != REG_NOMATCH)) {
02325                                                         EOUT << "dil2al: Internal error while matching ``pattern'' in find_in_line()\n";
02326                                                         mres = 4; done = true;
02327                                                 } else {
02328                                                         if (!mres) {
02329                                                                 done = true;
02330                                                                 if (nsub) {
02331                                                                         if (rm[nsub-1].rm_so==-1) {
02332                                                                                 EOUT << "dil2al: Wrong number of substring matches in find_in_line()\n";
02333                                                                                 mres = 3;
02334                                                                         } else {
02335                                                                                 for (int i=0; i<nsub; i++) {
02336                                                                                         strncpy(sbuf,&lbuf[rm[i].rm_so],rm[i].rm_eo-rm[i].rm_so);
02337                                                                                         sbuf[rm[i].rm_eo-rm[i].rm_so]='\0';
02338                                                                                         dilid[i] = sbuf;
02339                                                                                 }
02340                                                                         }
02341                                                                 }
02342                                                         }
02343                                                 }
02344                                         }
02345                                 }
02346                         }
02347                 }
02348                 regfree(&re);
02349                 regfree(&be);
02350                 if (nsub) delete[] rm;
02351                 return (-mres) + 1;
02352         } else {
02353                 EOUT << "dil2al: file not open in find_in_line()\n";
02354                 return -4;
02355         }
02356 }

00988 // if generatealtcs == 0, a complete AL will be computed, for
00989 // the completion of all DIL entries that are dependencies of
00990 // superior
00991 // if generatealmaxt > 0, the AL will be computed up to the
00992 // limit date specified
00993 // if generatealtcs > 0, the AL will be computed for that
00994 // number of Task Chunks

00996         if (!dep) {

00998                 return false;
00999         }

01116                         // randomly allocate TCs for this DIL entry
01117                         while ((req[i]>0) && (al.deavail>0)) {
01118                                 uval = sumval*(((float) rand()) / ((float) RAND_MAX));
01119                                 uval = al.allocate_with_value(uval,dep[i]);

01159         // randomly pick tasks that could not be allocated entirely before their target dates
01160         AL_TC * atc = al.Get_Avail_TC(0);
01161         int j, k = 1; cnt = 0;
01162         while (k>=0) {
01163                 // random DIL entry
01164                 j = (int) (((float) i)*((float) rand()) / ((float) RAND_MAX));
01165                 if (j>=i) j=i-1;
01166                 if (j<0) break; // i==0
01167                 // find nearest DIL entry requiring task chunks
01168                 // Note: current order of search gives partially
01169                 // allocated DIL entries priority over DIL entries
01170                 // with target dates prior to current time
01171                 for (k = j; ((k<i) && (req[k]<=0)); k++);
01172                 if (k>=i) for (k = (j-1); ((k>=0) && (req[k]<=0)); k--);
01173                 // allocate earliest available task chunk in AL
01174                 if (k>=0) {
01175                         if (al.allocate(dep[k])) {
01176                                 req[k]--;
01177 #ifdef DIAGNOSTIC_OUTPUT
01178                                 PLL_LOOP_FORWARD(AL_Day,al.AL_Head(),1) {
01179                                         EOUT << '|';
01180                                         if (e->TC_Head()) { 
01181                                                 for (AL_TC * etc = e->TC_Head(); (etc); etc = etc->Next())
01182                                                         if (etc->Get_DE()) EOUT << 'x'; else EOUT << '_';
01183                                         }
01184                                 }
01185                                 EOUT << '\n';
01186 #endif
01187                         } else break;
01188                 }
01189 #ifdef DEBUG
01190                 if ((cnt%10)==0) { VOUT << '+'; VOUT.flush(); }
01191 #endif
01192                 cnt++;
01193         }
01194         VOUT << "Scheduled tasks that could not be completed before target dates: " << cnt << '\n';
01195 #ifdef DIAGNOSTIC_OUTPUT
01196         EOUT << "*\n";
01197 #endif
01198         // randomly pick tasks that have target dates exceeding the AL interval
01199         int remlen = deplen - i;
01200         k = 0; cnt = 0;
01201         while (k<deplen) {
01202                 // random DIL entry
01203                 j = (int) (((float) remlen)*((float) rand()) / ((float) RAND_MAX));
01204                 if (j>=remlen) j=remlen-1;
01205                 if (j<0) break;
01206                 j += i;
01207                 // find nearest DIL entry requiring task chunks
01208                 for (k = j; ((k>=i) && (req[k]<=0)); k--);
01209                 if (k<i) for (k = (j+1); ((k<deplen) && (req[k]<=0)); k++);
01210                 // allocate earliest available task chunk in AL
01211                 if (k<deplen) {
01212                         if (al.allocate(dep[k])) {
01213                                 req[k]--;
01214 #ifdef DIAGNOSTIC_OUTPUT
01215                                 PLL_LOOP_FORWARD(AL_Day,al.AL_Head(),1) {
01216                                         EOUT << '|';
01217                                         if (e->TC_Head()) { 
01218                                                 for (AL_TC * etc = e->TC_Head(); (etc); etc = etc->Next())
01219                                                         if (etc->Get_DE()) EOUT << 'x'; else EOUT << '_';
01220                                         }
01221                                 }
01222                                 EOUT << '\n';
01223 #endif
01224                         } else break;
01225                 }
01226 #ifdef DEBUG
01227                 if ((cnt%10)==0) { VOUT << '"'; VOUT.flush(); }
01228 #endif
01229         }
01230         VOUT << "Scheduled tasks for DIL entries with target dates beyond requested range: " << cnt << '\n';
01231         // clean up by removing unused TCs
01232 #ifdef DIAGNOSTIC_OUTPUT
01233         PLL_LOOP_FORWARD(AL_Day,al.AL_Head(),1) for (AL_TC * etc = e->TC_Head(); (etc); etc=etc->Next()) if (!etc->Get_DE()) cerr << '?'; cerr << '\n';
01234 #endif
01235         al.remove_unused_TCs();
01236         // create visible AL
01237         if (!al.generate_focused_AL(superior,algenhpd)) LOCAL_CLEAN_EXIT
01238         if (!al.generate_wide_AL(superior)) LOCAL_CLEAN_EXIT
01239         // update DIL, AL, TL main page
01240         if (!update_main_ALs(superior)) LOCAL_CLEAN_EXIT
01241         // clean up
01242         delete[] req;
01243         return true;
01244 }

00027                                                                                                                                                                                     {
00028 // obtains missing figure data from the Figures Directory
00029 // this function can be called with data in either figfile or figlabel
00030         const BigRegex figintextrx("%[  ]*@Begin INTEXT@[ \t\n]*\\(.*\\)%[      ]*@End INTEXT@");
00031         int srcidx;
00032         if ((srcidx = get_file_in_list(figuresdirectory,srcf,srcfname,srcfnum))<0)
00033                 EOUT << "dil2al: Some figure data may be missing in get_figure_data(), continuing as is\n";
00034         else {
00035                 // find figure data
00036                 String findid;
00037                 if (!figfile.empty()) findid = relurl(figuresdirectory,figfile);
00038                 else if (!figlabel.empty()) findid = figlabel;
00039                 else EOUT << "dil2al: No figure file or label, some figure data may be missing in get_figure_data(), continuing as is\n";
00040                 if (!findid.empty()) {
00041                         int figididx;
00042                         if ((figididx = srcf[srcidx].index(BigRegex("[<]!--[    ]@Begin FIGURE DATA:[^@]*"+RX_Search_Safe(findid)+"[^@]*@[      ]*--[>]")))<0) {
00043                                 EOUT << "dil2al: Figure " << findid << " not found in get_figure_data(), continuing as is\n";

00045                                 if (figlabel.empty()) {
00046                                         figlabel = figfile.after('/',-1);
00047                                         if (figlabel.empty()) figlabel = figfile;
00048                                         if (figlabel.index('.',-1)>=0) figlabel = figlabel.before('.',-1);
00049                                         figlabel.prepend("fig:");
00050                                 }
00051                         } else {

00055                                 else {

00057                                         // get figure label
00058                                         figlabel = figdata.at(BigRegex("[<]!--[         ]*@Figure label@[       ]*--[>][        ]*[^]<  \n]+"));
00059                                         figlabel = figlabel.after(BigRegex("[<]!--[     ]*@Figure label@[       ]*--[>][        ]*"));
00060                                         // get figure file
00061                                         figfile = figdata.at(BigRegex("[<]!--[  ]*@Figure file@[        ]*--[>][        ]*[^<   \n]+"));
00062                                         figfile = figfile.after(BigRegex("[<]!--[       ]*@Figure file@[        ]*--[>][        ]*"));
00063                                         int fci = figdata.index(BigRegex("[<]!--[       ]*@Figure caption@[     ]*--[>][        ]*"),String::SEARCH_END);
00064                                         // get figure caption
00065                                         figcaption = ""; figintext = "";
00066                                         if (fci<0) EOUT << "dil2al: Figure " << findid << " ``@Figure caption@'' marker missing in get_figure_data(), continuing as is\n";
00067                                         else {
00068                                                 int fce = figdata.index(BigRegex("[<][Bb][Rr][>][ \t\n]*PSfrag"),fci);
00069                                                 if (fce<0) EOUT << "dil2al: Figure " << findid << " ``<BR>\\nPSfrag'' caption end code missing in get_figure_data(), continuing as is\n";
00070                                                 else {
00071                                                         figcaption = figdata.at(fci,fce-fci);
00072                                                         if (figcaption.index(figintextrx)>=0) { // identify ``INTEXT'' figure descriptions
00073                                                                 figintext = "% @Begin INTEXT@\n" + figcaption.sub(figintextrx,1) + "% @End INTEXT@\n"; // place new markers to ensure line ends
00074                                                                 fci = figintextrx.subpos(0); fce = figintextrx.subpos(0)+figintextrx.sublen(0);
00075                                                                 if (fci>0) if (figcaption.elem(fci-1)=='\n') fci--;
00076                                                                 if (fce<figcaption.length()) if (figcaption.elem(fce)=='\n') fce++;
00077                                                                 figcaption.del(fci,fce-fci);
00078                                                         }
00079                                                         // remove troublesome characters from figure caption (cannot use the convert_item_content_to_TeX() function,
00080                                                         // since content is already assumed to be in TeX format with codes such as $math-stuff$
00081                                                         if (figcaption.gsub(BigRegex("\\([^\\]\\)[%<>]"),"_1X",'_')>0) if (verbose) VOUT << "TeX Correction: Changed special characters in figure caption to `X'\n";
00082                                                         if (figcaption.gsub(BigRegex("^[%<>]"),"X")>0) if (verbose) VOUT << "TeX Correction: Changed special characters in figure caption to `X'\n";
00083                                                 }
00084                                         }
00085                                         // get PS conversions
00086                                         int pscidx;
00087                                         if ((pscidx = figdata.index(BigRegex("[<]!--[   ]*@Begin Figure psconversions@[         ]*--[>][        ]*"),String::SEARCH_END))>=0) {
00088                                                 int pscend;
00089                                                 if ((pscend = figdata.index(BigRegex("[<]!--[   ]*@End Figure psconversions@[   ]*--[>]"),pscidx))>=0)
00090                                                         psconversions = figdata.at(pscidx,pscend-pscidx);
00091                                                         if (psconversions=="\n") psconversions = "";
00092                                         }
00093                                 }
00094                         }
00095                 }
00096         }
00097         if (figfile.empty()) figfile = homedir+"doc/tex/common-eps/placeholder.eps";
00098         if (figlabel.empty()) figlabel = "fig:unknown";
00099         if (figcaption.empty()) figcaption = "\\relax";
00100         if (psconversions.empty()) psconversions = "\\relax";
00101 }

int HTML_get_tagged_environment (  const BigRegex &    begintag,
const BigRegex &    endmatch,
const BigRegex &    endtag,
String &    htmlstr,
int    strloc,
String &    envparams,
String &    envcontent,
int *    envstart = NULL
) 
 

Definition at line 2433 of file utilities.cc.

References String::at(), HTML_get_marker(), String::index(), String::length(), and String::SEARCH_END.

Referenced by HTML_get_list(), HTML_get_list_item(), HTML_get_table_cell(), and HTML_get_table_row(). 

02433                                                                                                                                                                                                              {
02434 // searches for an environment beginning with a tag matching begintag,
02435 // determines the environment end according to possible matches in endmatch,
02436 // returns tag parameters in envparams, environment contents in envcontent,
02437 // optionally returns the start of the environment in envstart, and
02438 // returns the position directly after the environment and a potential
02439 // endtag
02440         // find start of environment
02441         if ((strloc=htmlstr.index(begintag,strloc))<0) return -1;
02442         if (envstart) (*envstart) = strloc;
02443         // get environment tag parameters
02444         if ((strloc=HTML_get_marker(htmlstr,strloc,envparams,false))<0) return -1;
02445         // get environment content
02446         int envend = htmlstr.index(endmatch,strloc);
02447         if (envend<0) envend = htmlstr.length();
02448         envcontent = htmlstr.at(strloc,envend-strloc);
02449         // skip possible end tag
02450         int envendtagend = htmlstr.index(endtag,String::SEARCH_END,envend);
02451         if (envendtagend>=0) envend = envendtagend;
02452         return envend;
02453 }

String Int2HexStr (  unsigned int    i ) 
 

Definition at line 2666 of file utilities.cc.

References String::prepend(). 

02666                                   {
02667   // convert integer to hexadecimal string
02668   String s;
02669   if (i==0) s = "0";
02670   else {
02671     while (i>0) {
02672       int j = i % 16; i = i / 16;
02673       if (j<10) s.prepend(('0'+(char) j));
02674       else s.prepend(('A'+(char) (j-10)));
02675     }
02676   }
02677   return s;
02678 }

00944                                                                              {
00945 // seeks from seekfrom through the task log to find the
00946 // most recent chunk, set seekfrom==-1 to search backwards
00947 // from the end of the task log
00948 // returns the starting location of the most recent chunk or the
00949 // beginning of the section (-1 == not found)
00950 // if chunkid!=NULL sets (*chunkid) to the chunk ID or to "" if
00951 // the beginning of the section is returned
00952 // requires a valid task log section in tl
00953         int tlinsertloc;

00956                 if ((tlinsertloc = tl.index(BigRegex("[<]!--[   ]+section Begin[        ]+--[>]")))<0) {
00957                         // TL section not properly formatted
00958                         EOUT << "dil2al: Section Begin not found in " << taskloghead << " in locate_most_recent_TL_chunk()\n";
00959                         return -1;
00960                 } 
00961                 return tlinsertloc;
00962         }

00964                 // get chunk time stamp at tlinsertloc

00968         return tlinsertloc;
00969 }

00516         return process_note(notetmpfile,notedst);
00517 }

01050                                                               {
01051 // modify the target date of dilid in all self- or superior-
01052 // references (dilid can be initialized from a String) and
01053 // write to DIL ID file
01054 // Target dates are modified locally, without regard to target
01055 // dates of superiors. If no target date was previously given,
01056 // a set of parameters is created. The target date -1 indicates
01057 // that target dates should be set to "?", i.e. unspecified.
01058 // Modifications are made only if tdate differs from Target_Date().
01059 // (Note: Use `modify_DIL_group_target_date()' to update the
01060 // target date with minimal disturbances of relationships
01061 // between dependencies and superiors within a group of DIL
01062 // entries.)
01063         // modify dilid target dates
01064         Detailed_Items_List dilist;
01065         if (!modify_DIL_entry_target_date(dilid,tdate,dilist)) return false;
01066         // place new data and copy rest
01067 #ifdef VERBOSEDEBUG
01068         PLL_LOOP_FORWARD(DIL_entry,dilist.list.head(),1) {
01069                 EOUT << e->chars();
01070                 if (e->Projects(0)) EOUT << '\t' << e->Projects(0)->targetdate();
01071                 EOUT << '\n';
01072         }
01073 #endif
01074 #ifdef DEBUG
01075         bool res = dilist.Write_to_File();
01076         if (res) EOUT << "Modified DIL entry target date and stored to DIL ID file\n";
01077         return res;
01078 #else
01079         return dilist.Write_to_File();
01080 #endif
01081 }

Definition at line 976 of file diladmin.cc. 

00976                                                                                             {
00977 // modify the target date of dilid in all self- or superior-
00978 // references (dilid can be initialized from a String)
00979 // Target dates are modified locally, without regard to target
00980 // dates of superiors. If no target date was previously given,
00981 // a set of parameters is created. The target date -1 indicates
00982 // that target dates should be set to "?", i.e. unspecified.
00983 // If dilist is empty, Get_All_DIL_ID_File_Parameters() is called.
00984 // Modifications are made only if tdate differs from Target_Date().
00985 // (Note: Use `modify_DIL_group_target_date()' to update the
00986 // target date with minimal disturbances of relationships
00987 // between dependencies and superiors within a group of DIL
00988 // entries.)
00989 // *** perhaps there should be a way to `force' modification if
00990 //     it is used to ensure that the target date is local
00991         // get DIL parameter sets
00992         int entrynum;
00993 #ifdef DEBUGTIER1
00994         VOUT << "dil2al: [DEBUGTIER1] Modifying for DIL#" << dilid.chars() << " to tdate=" << tdate << " (" << time_stamp("%Y%m%d%H%M",tdate) << ")\n";
00995 #endif
00996         if (!dilist.list.head()) entrynum=dilist.Get_All_DIL_ID_File_Parameters();
00997         else entrynum=dilist.list.length();
00998         if (entrynum<=0) {
00999                 EOUT << "No DIL entries found in " << idfile << " in modify_DIL_entry_target_date(), continuing as is\n";
01000                 return false;
01001         }
01002 #ifdef DEBUGTIER2
01003         VOUT << "dil2al: [DEBUGTIER2] Modification progress: 1";
01004 #endif
01005         // get first entry in list
01006         DIL_entry * de = dilist.list.head();
01007         // if (!de) return false; // should never happen when entrynum>0
01008         DIL_entry * did = de->elbyid(dilid);
01009         if (!did) {
01010                 EOUT << "DIL entry " << dilid << " not found in " << idfile << " in modify_DIL_entry_target_date(), continuing as is\n";
01011                 return false;
01012         }
01013 #ifdef DEBUGTIER2
01014         VOUT << ", 2";
01015 #endif
01016         if (did->Target_Date()!=tdate) { // modify only if different
01017                 if (!did->parameters) {
01018                         EOUT << "DIL entry " << dilid << " parameters not found in " << idfile << " in modify_DIL_entry_target_date(), continuing as is\n";
01019                         return false;
01020                 }
01021 #ifdef DEBUGTIER2
01022         VOUT << ", 3\n";
01023 #endif
01024                 // modify dilid target dates
01025                 if (did->Projects(0)) PLL_LOOP_FORWARD(DIL_AL_List,did->Projects(0),1) {
01026 #ifdef DEBUGTIER2
01027                         VOUT << "e->targetdate = tdate\n";
01028 #endif
01029                         if (!e->set_targetdate(tdate)) VOUT << "Unable to modify FIXED target date of ref.#" << dilid << "->#" << e->al.title << '\n';
01030                 } else if (tdate>=0) { // create self-reference for specified target date
01031                         // *** Modify this if the data format changes
01032 #ifdef DEBUGTIER2
01033                         VOUT << "did->parameters->project_append\n";
01034 #endif

01036                 }
01037 #ifdef DEBUGTIER1
01038                 VOUT << "dil2al: [DEBUGTIER1] Modification performed\n";
01039 #endif
01040         }
01041 #ifdef DEBUGTIER2
01042         else VOUT << ", target date already correct\n";
01043 #endif
01044 #ifdef DEBUG
01045         EOUT << "Modified DIL entry target date\n";
01046 #endif
01047         return true;

bool modify_DIL_group_target_dates (  Detailed_Items_List &    dilgroup,
bool    minfragmentation = true
) 
 

Definition at line 1083 of file diladmin.cc.

Referenced by modify_DIL_group_target_dates_cmd(). 

01083                                                                                                  {
01084 // Adjust the target dates of DIL entries listed in dilgroup,
01085 // utilizing propagation rules to minimize the number of
01086 // locally specified target dates where superiors can be
01087 // modified and are members of the group. Desired target dates
01088 // are specified in dilgroup.list[i]->Projects(0)->_targetdate,
01089 // so that they can be obtained through dilgroup.list[i]->Target_Date().
01090 // A target date is not changed if it is the same as the
01091 // entry's current Target_Date() or if -2 was specified.
01092 // A target date specification of -1 implies that it will be
01093 // set to `DILSUPS_TD_UNSPECIFIED'.
01094 #ifdef DEBUG_REPORT_DEVIATIONS
01095         int tdmodifdeviations = 0;
01096 #endif
01097         Detailed_Items_List dilist; DIL_entry * de, * did; time_t tdate;
01098 #ifdef DEBUGTIER2
01099         time_t * oldtargetdate;
01100         if (!dilist.list.head()) dilist.Get_All_DIL_ID_File_Parameters();
01101         oldtargetdate = new time_t[dilist.list.length()];
01102         for (int i=0; i<dilist.list.length(); i++) oldtargetdate[i] = dilist.list.el(i)->Local_Target_Date(0);
01103 #endif
01104         if (minfragmentation) { // apply minimization rules
01105 #ifdef DEBUGTIER2
01106         VOUT << "dil2al: [DEBUGTIER2] Applying rules to minimize fragmentation\n";
01107 #endif
01108                 int entrynum=dilist.Get_All_DIL_ID_File_Parameters();
01109                 if (entrynum<=0) {
01110                         EOUT << "No DIL entries found in " << idfile << " in modify_DIL_group_target_dates(), continuing as is\n";
01111                         return false;
01112                 }
01113                 DIL_entry * de = dilist.list.head();
01114                 // sort dilgroup in reverse order of desired target dates
01115                 // - thus superiors with the latest target date are updated first (minimizes insulations)
01116                 DIL_entry ** e = dilgroup.Sort_by_Target_Date(); // traverse in reverse order, highest to lowest
01117                 #define MODIFY_DIL_GROUP_TARGET_DATES_RETURN_WITH_CLEANUP(res) delete[] e; return res
01118                 for (int i = dilgroup.list.length()-1; i>=0; i--) if ((tdate=e[i]->Local_Target_Date(0))>=-1) { // iterate through dilgroup members
01119                         did = de->elbyid(*(e[i]));
01120                         if (!did) {
01121                                 EOUT << "DIL entry " << e[i]->chars() << " not found in " << idfile << " in modify_DIL_group_target_dates(), continuing as is\n";
01122                                 MODIFY_DIL_GROUP_TARGET_DATES_RETURN_WITH_CLEANUP(false);
01123                         }
01124                         if (did->Projects(0)) PLL_LOOP_FORWARD_NESTED(DIL_Superiors,did->Projects(0),1,pe) { // iterate through corresponding dilist member superiors
01125                                 // Note: Do this even if did->Target_Date()==tdate to insure that
01126                                 //       did->Target_Date()==tdate will also be true after the
01127                                 //       target dates of superiors may have been modified.
01128                                 // *** can set local target date if pe refers to self
01129                                 //     once superior references are pointer parameters
01130                                 // set `local' target date specifications to desired target date
01131                                 if (pe->targetdate()>=0) { 
01132                                         if (!pe->set_targetdate(tdate)) VOUT << "Unable to modify FIXED target date of ref.#" << e[i]->chars() << "->#" << pe->al.title << '\n';
01133                                 } else if (tdate>=0) {
01134                                         if (pe->IsSelfReference()) {
01135                                                 EOUT << "dil2al: Warning - Correcting self-reference without local target date in modify_DIL_group_target_dates\n()";
01136                                                 if (!pe->set_targetdate(tdate)) VOUT << "Unable to modify FIXED target date of ref.#" << e[i]->chars() << "->#" << pe->al.title << '\n';
01137                                         } else {
01138                                                 DIL_ID peid(pe->al.title);
01139                                                 DIL_entry * peg = dilgroup.list.head()->elbyid(peid); // can't use Superiorbyid() here, since getting in dilgroup
01140                                                 time_t petdate = -1;
01141                                                 if (peg) petdate = peg->Local_Target_Date(0); // to insure that code -1 is detected
01142                                                 DIL_entry * sup = pe->Superiorbyid();
01143                                                 if (!sup) {
01144                                                         EOUT << "dil2al: DIL entry superior with ID #" << pe->al.title << " not found in modify_DIL_group_target_dates(), continuing as is\n";
01145                                                         continue;
01146                                                 }
01147                                                 // if superior pe of e is in dilgroup with same desired TD
01148                                                 // then pe will take care of update (beware of loops)
01149                                                 if (petdate==tdate) continue;
01150                                                 // if pe->Target_Date() is earlier than desired
01151                                                 // then set desired locally (don't alter superior, since
01152                                                 // that could affect other dependencies of that superior)
01153                                                 if (sup->Target_Date()<tdate) { // insulate from superior's target date
01154                                                         if (!pe->set_targetdate(tdate)) VOUT << "Unable to modify FIXED target date of ref.#" << e[i]->chars() << "->#" << pe->al.title << '\n';
01155                                                 } else {
01156                                                         // if pe in dilgroup and pe desired < e desired
01157                                                         // and relevance not 1.0 or unspecified then set locally
01158                                                         // else warn incompatibility for fully relevant dependency
01159                                                         if ((peg) && (petdate<tdate)) {
01160                                                                 if ((pe->relevance<1.0) && (pe->relevance!=DILSUPS_REL_UNSPECIFIED)) {
01161                                                                         // set locally, because superior will be set to earlier
01162                                                                         if (!pe->set_targetdate(tdate)) VOUT << "Unable to modify FIXED target date of ref.#" << e[i]->chars() << "->#" << pe->al.title << '\n';
01163                                                                         continue;
01164                                                                 } else EOUT << "dil2al: Warning - earlier target date requested for superior with ID #" << pe->al.title << " than for dependency with ID # " << e[i]->chars() << " in modify_DIL_group_target_dates(), continuing\n";
01165                                                         }
01166                                                         // if pe is last superior and Target_Date() is still
01167                                                         // > desired then set locally
01168                                                         if (!pe->Next()) if (did->Target_Date()>tdate) {
01169                                                                 if (!pe->set_targetdate(tdate)) VOUT << "Unable to modify FIXED target date of ref.#" << e[i]->chars() << "->#" << pe->al.title << '\n';
01170                                                         }
01171                                                 }
01172                                         }
01173                                 }
01174                         } else if (tdate>=0) { // unless setting to unspecified, make a self-reference
01175                                 // *** Modify this if the data format changes
01176                                 if (!did->parameters) did->parameters = new DIL_entry_parameters(*did);
01177                                 did->parameters->project_append(idfile+'#'+did->chars(),did->chars(),DILSUPS_REL_UNSPECIFIED,DILSUPS_UNB_UNSPECIFIED,DILSUPS_BND_UNSPECIFIED,tdate,0,DILSUPS_URG_UNSPECIFIED,DILSUPS_PRI_UNSPECIFIED);
01178                         }
01179                 }
01180                 // Double-check to insure that target dates are detected as requested
01181                 for (int i = dilgroup.list.length()-1; i>=0; i--) if ((tdate=e[i]->Local_Target_Date(0))>=0) { // iterate through dilgroup members
01182                         did = de->elbyid(*(e[i]));
01183                         if (did->Target_Date()!=tdate) {
01184 #ifdef DEBUG_REPORT_DEVIATIONS
01185                                 tdmodifdeviations++; // useful when testing functional or rule-based approach above
01186 #endif
01187                                 if (did->Projects(0)) {
01188                                         if (did->Target_Date()>tdate) {
01189                                                 if (!did->Projects(0)->set_targetdate(tdate)) VOUT << "Unable to modify FIXED target date of ref.#" << e[i]->chars() << "->#" << did->Projects(0)->al.title << '\n';
01190                                                 else VOUT << "Forcing target date adjustment at DIL entry #" << did->chars() << " superior reference " << did->Projects(0)->al.title << '\n';
01191                                         } else PLL_LOOP_FORWARD_NESTED(DIL_Superiors,did->Projects(0),1,pe) { // iterate through corresponding dilist member superiors
01192                                                 if (pe->targetdate() < tdate) {
01193                                                         if (!pe->set_targetdate(tdate)) VOUT << "Unable to modify FIXED target date of ref.#" << e[i]->chars() << "->#" << pe->al.title << '\n';
01194                                                         else VOUT << "Forcing target date adjustment at DIL entry #" << did->chars() << " superior reference " << pe->al.title << '\n';
01195                                                 }
01196                                         }
01197                                 }
01198                         }
01199                 }
01200                 // Final test of detected target dates achieved
01201                 for (int i = dilgroup.list.length()-1; i>=0; i--) if ((tdate=e[i]->Local_Target_Date(0))>=0) // iterate through dilgroup members
01202                         if (de->elbyid(*(e[i]))->Target_Date()!=tdate) EOUT << "dil2al: Unable to set target date for DIL#" << did->chars() << " in modify_DIL_group_target_dates(), continuing as is\n";
01203                 delete[] e;
01204         } else PLL_LOOP_FORWARD(DIL_entry,dilgroup.list.head(),1) { // modify target dates directly
01205                 tdate = e->Local_Target_Date(0); // not using Target_Date() to insure -1 and -2 codes are detected
01206                 if (tdate>=-1) if (!modify_DIL_entry_target_date(*e,tdate,dilist)) return false;
01207         }
01208 #ifdef DEBUGTIER2
01209         int i = 0;
01210         PLL_LOOP_FORWARD(DIL_entry,dilist.list.head(),1) {
01211                 if (e->Local_Target_Date(0)!=oldtargetdate[i]) cout << "dil2al: [DEBUGTIER2] Changed DIL entry #" << e->chars() << ", old=" << oldtargetdate[i] << " (" << time_stamp("%Y%m%d%H%M",oldtargetdate[i]) << "), new=" << e->Local_Target_Date(0) << " (" << time_stamp("%Y%m%d%H%M",e->Local_Target_Date(0)) << ") TD=" << time_stamp("%Y%m%d%H%M",e->Target_Date()) << '\n';
01212                 i++;
01213         }
01214         delete[] oldtargetdate;
01215 #endif
01216 #ifdef DEBUG_REPORT_DEVIATIONS
01217         EOUT << "dil2al: [DEBUG_REPORT_DEVIATIONS] Target Date Modification Deviations = " << tdmodifdeviations << '\n';
01218 #endif
01219 #ifdef DEBUG
01220         bool res = dilist.Write_to_File();
01221         if (res) EOUT << "Modified DIL group target dates and stored to DIL ID file\n";
01222         return res;
01223 #else
01224         return dilist.Write_to_File();
01225 #endif
01226 /*
01227 An alternative approach
01228 -----------------------
01229 Note that the concept below needs to be worked out for the case of muiltiple
01230 superiors at each level, i.e. when tracking through the superiors structure,
01231 all path possibilities must be marked/remembered, instead of just using pe as
01232 a roadblock. Due to this, and the depth-search itself, it is unclear if this
01233 functional approach is more or less efficient than the rule-based one. It also
01234 remains to be seen if this approach follows all the same rules as the rule-based
01235 approach.
01236 
01237 From furthest TD to nearest TD in list of DIL entries:
01238 
01239 isgroupsuperior()
01240         if (!pe) return false;
01241         e = dilgroup.list.head()->elbyid(*pe);
01242         if (!e) return false;
01243         if (e->Target_Date()!=tdate) return false;
01244         return true;
01245 
01246 while Target_Date()!=tdate
01247         pe = NULL
01248         while (!isgroupsuperior(pe)) pe = Target_Date_Specified(pe);
01249         if (pe->Projects(0)) pe->Projects(0)->_targetdate = tdate;
01250         else pe->parameters->add_project(...,tdate,...);
01251 */
01252 }

bool modify_DIL_group_target_dates_cmd (  bool    minfragmentation,

)

Referenced by Detect_Form_Input(), and Modify_Element(). 

01254                                                                                          {
01255 // Command line interface to modify_DIL_group_target_dates().
01256 // Reads pairs of DIL entry IDs and desired target dates (with
01257 // optional -2 code to indicate no target date modification, and
01258 // -1 to unspecify local target date parameters).
01259 // Data is read from the DIN stream.
01260 // If qlist is not NULL then HTML form data is obtained from qlist.
01261         const BigRegex td("^TD\\([0-9]+[.][0-9]+\\)=");
01262         const BigRegex tdchkbx("^TDCHKBX\\([0-9]+[.][0-9]+\\)=");
01263         const BigRegex pairsep("[ \t,:;]+");
01264         const BigRegex nonnumerals("[^-0-9]");
01265         String modifdata;
01266         if (qlist) { // HTML form interface
01267                 StringList exclude; int excludenum = 0;
01268                 int qnum = qlist->length()-1; // *** empty element at end of StringList
01269                 for (int i = 0; i<qnum; i++) {
01270                 // *** Beware: This code assumes that DIL entry IDs do not
01271                 //     occur as subsets of other DIL entry IDs, i.e. it
01272                 //     assumes that a move to IDs with more digits would imply
01273                 //     prepending older IDs with 0s. This could of course be
01274                 //     handled by a preprocessing loop.
01275 #ifdef DEBUGTIER2
01276                         cout << '$' << (*qlist)[i] << '\n';
01277 #endif
01278                         if ((*qlist)[i].contains("TDupdate=")) {
01279                                 if ((*qlist)[i].after('=')=="direct") minfragmentation = false;
01280                                 else minfragmentation = true;
01281                         } else if ((*qlist)[i].contains(td)) {
01282                                 modifdata += (*qlist)[i].at(td.subpos(1),td.sublen(1)) + ' ';
01283                                 String tdstr = (*qlist)[i].after('='); if (tdstr.length()==0) tdstr = "-2";
01284                                 modifdata += tdstr + '\n';
01285                         } else if ((*qlist)[i].contains(tdchkbx)) {
01286                                 String chkbxid = (*qlist)[i].at(tdchkbx.subpos(1),tdchkbx.sublen(1));
01287                                 String tdstr = (*qlist)[i].after('=');
01288                                 if (tdstr=="noupdate") { // set corresponding desired target date to code -2
01289                                         exclude[excludenum] = chkbxid;
01290                                         excludenum++;
01291                                 }
01292                         }
01293                 }
01294                 for (int i = 0; i<excludenum; i++) modifdata.gsub(BigRegex(RX_Search_Safe(exclude[i])+" [-0-9]*"),exclude[i]+" -2");
01295         } else {
01296                 if (useansi) VOUT << ANSI_BOLD_ON;
01297                 VOUT << "Enter group of DIL entries to consider for target date modification.\n";
01298                 if (useansi) VOUT << ANSI_BOLD_OFF;
01299                 VOUT << "Rows of DIL entry ID and desired target date pairs.\n\
01300 Special desired target date codes:\n\
01301 -1 = set to `unspecified', -2 = no desired target date (but modifiable).\n\
01302 Separate pairs with any number of spaces, tabs, commas, colons or semicolons.\n\
01303 End of File (Ctrl+D) or a line stating `EOF' completes data entry.\n\n";
01304                 if (useansi) VOUT << ANSI_UNDERLINE_ON;
01305                 VOUT << "DIL entry ID#\tdesired target date\n";
01306                 if (useansi) VOUT << ANSI_UNDERLINE_OFF;
01307                 read_data_from_stream(DIN,modifdata,"EOF");
01308         }
01309         StringList modiflist(modifdata,'\n');
01310         int groupsize = modiflist.length()-1; // *** last entry empty when initializing from string with separator
01311         Detailed_Items_List dilgroup; DIL_entry * de; String did; time_t tdate;
01312 #ifdef DEBUGTIER2
01313         cout << "Content-Type: text/plain\n\ndil2al: [DEBUGTIER2]\n";
01314         for (int j=0; j<groupsize; j++) {
01315                 String & s = modiflist[j];
01316                 cout << s << '\n';
01317         }
01318         cout << "+++\n";
01319 #endif
01320         for (int i=0; i<groupsize; i++) {
01321                 did = modiflist[i].after(pairsep); if (did.index(nonnumerals)>=0) did = did.before(nonnumerals);
01322                 tdate = time_stamp_time(did);
01323                 did = modiflist[i].before(pairsep);
01324                 de = new DIL_entry(dilgroup,did);
01325                 de->parameters = new DIL_entry_parameters(*de);
01326                 de->parameters->project_append('#'+did,did,DILSUPS_REL_UNSPECIFIED,DILSUPS_UNB_UNSPECIFIED,DILSUPS_BND_UNSPECIFIED,tdate,0,DILSUPS_URG_UNSPECIFIED,DILSUPS_PRI_UNSPECIFIED);
01327                 dilgroup.list.link_before(de);
01328         }
01329 #ifdef DEBUGTIER1
01330         if (minfragmentation) cout << "dil2al: [DEBUGTIER1] Minimum fragmentation\n"; else cout << "dil2al: [DEBUGTIER1] Direct\n";
01331 #endif
01332 #ifdef DEBUGTIER2
01333         for (int i=0; i<groupsize; i++) {
01334                 cout << "dil2al: [DEBUGTIER2] " << dilgroup.list.el(i)->chars() << '\t';
01335                 if (dilgroup.list.el(i)->Local_Target_Date(0)<0) cout << dilgroup.list.el(i)->Local_Target_Date(0) << '\n';
01336                 else cout << time_stamp("%Y%m%d%H%M",dilgroup.list.el(i)->Local_Target_Date(0)) << '\n';
01337         }
01338 #endif
01339         return modify_DIL_group_target_dates(dilgroup,minfragmentation);
01340 }

00007 // Process note shorthand codes to HTML and fill in @tags@
00008         // line breaks
00009         notestr.gsub("\n","<BR>\n");
00010         // paragraphs
00011         notestr.gsub(BigRegex("<BR>\n\\(<BR>\n\\)+"),"\n<P>\n");

00013         notestr.gsub(BigRegex("^[       ]*-[    ]+"),"<LI>");

00016                 notestr.at(BigRegex("^[         ]*[*][  ]+"),lstart)="<UL>\n<LI>";

00018                         lstart = lend+1;

00021                         } else break;
00022                 }
00023                 if (lend<0) { lend = notestr.length(); notestr += "\n"; }

00027         // tag definitions

00034                         novcount++;

00040         }

00042         // clean up

00044         notestr.gsub("<BR><P>","<P>");
00045         notestr.gsub("<P><BR>","<P>");

00047         notestr.gsub("<P>\n<P>","<P>");

00049         notestr.gsub("<BR>\n<LI>","\n<LI>");

00174         notestr.gsub(BigRegex("[<]/[Ee][Mm]\\([         ]+[^>]*[>]\\|[>]\\)"),"}"); // </EM>
00175         notestr.gsub(BigRegex("[<][Ss][Tt][Rr][Oo][Nn][Gg][     ]*[^>]*[>]"),"{\\bf "); // <STRONG>
00176         notestr.gsub(BigRegex("[<]/[Ss][Tt][Rr][Oo][Nn][Gg][    ]*[^>]*[>]"),"}"); // </STRONG>
00177         // <A HREF="http://the-reference-url/">the-reference-text</A>
00178         // <A NAME="the-reference-name-tag">the-reference-anchor</A>

00180         while (i>=0) {
00181                 i = notestr.index(BigRegex("[<][Aa][    ]+[^>]*\\([Hh][Rr][Ee][Ff]\\|[Nn][Aa][Mm][Ee]\\)[       ]*=[    ]*[^>]*[>].*[<]/[Aa][   ]*[^>]*[>]"),j);

00192                         notestr = notestr.before(i);
00193                         notestr += tmpstr;

01256                                               {
01257 // removes the top task chunk if it has DIL entry ID dilid
01258 // from the AL indicated by alref and updates the suggested
01259 // start time of that AL day according to the assumed time
01260 // taken to do the task chunk (desynchronization is noticed
01261 // and taken care of in select_TL_DIL_refs())
01262 // day rows at the top of the AL that are not followed by task
01263 // rows are removed
01264 // returns false if dilid did not match the DIL entry ID of
01265 // the top task chunk, or if the visible focused AL became
01266 // empty
01267         String alstr, newalstr;
01268         if (!read_file_into_String(alref,alstr)) return false;
01269         newalstr.alloc(alstr.length());
01270         // get day row and remove empty days at top of AL
01271         // and find top TC to compare with dilid
01272         StringList alentries; int numentries = 0, alpos = 0, tcsfound = 0, tcentries[2], rowstart, rowend;
01273         while (tcsfound<2) {
01274                 switch (get_AL_entry(alstr,alpos,alentries[numentries],rowstart,rowend)) {
01275                         case -1:
01276                                 // *** could detect from numentries and tcsfound
01277                                 //     to give a different VOUT message if the
01278                                 //     visible AL portion contained no more TCs
01279                                 EOUT << "Missing data in AL " << alref << " after position " << alpos << " in remove_AL_TC()";
01280                                 return false;
01281                                 break;
01282                         case 0: break;
01283                         case 1:
01284                                 if (numentries==0) {
01285                                         EOUT << "TC without preceding Day ID in " << alref << " after position " << alpos << " in remove_AL_TC()";
01286                                         return false;
01287                                 }
01288                                 if (tcsfound==0) {
01289                                         String alhrefurl, alhreftext;
01290                                         if (HTML_get_href(alentries[numentries],0,alhrefurl,alhreftext)<0) {
01291                                                 EOUT << "Missing DIL ID reference in " << alref << " after position " << alpos << " in remove_AL_TC()";
01292                                                 return false;
01293                                         }
01294                                         if (alhreftext!=dilid) { // different task
01295                                                 VOUT << "Top of AL " << alref << " does not match DIL entry " << dilid << '\n';
01296                                                 return false;
01297                                         }
01298                                 }
01299                                 tcentries[tcsfound] = numentries;
01300                                 tcsfound++;
01301                                 break;
01302                 }
01303                 if (alpos==0) newalstr = alstr.at(0,rowstart); // copy head of AL
01304                 numentries++; alpos = rowend;
01305         }
01306         if (tcentries[1]==(tcentries[0]+1)) { // next TC on same day, modify daystart
01307                 BigRegex rds("(suggested start[         ]+\\([0-9][0-9]:[0-9][0-9]\\)");
01308                 int didx = tcentries[0]-1, dstimepos;
01309                 if ((dstimepos=alentries[didx].index(rds))<0) {
01310                         EOUT << "Missing suggested start in AL " << alref << " at row " << didx << " in remove_AL_TC()\n";
01311                         return false;
01312                 }
01313                 String daystartstr = alentries[didx].at(rds.subpos(1),rds.sublen(1));
01314                 daystartstr.del(':');
01315                 time_t tds = time_stamp_time_of_day(daystartstr) + ((time_t) (timechunksize*60));
01316                 if (tds>=SECONDSPERDAY) {
01317                         VOUT << "Updated suggested start time exceeds length of day, limiting to 23:59\n";
01318                         tds = SECONDSPERDAY-1;
01319                 }
01320                 daystartstr = time_stamp_GM("%H:%M",tds);
01321                 for (int i = 0; i<5; i++) alentries[didx][rds.subpos(1)+i] = daystartstr[i];
01322         }
01323         // determine day before second TC and write it
01324         int didx = tcentries[1]-1;
01325         if (didx==tcentries[0]) didx--;
01326         newalstr += HTML_put_table_row(DEFAULTALDAYEMPHASIS,alentries[didx]) + '\n';
01327         // write second TC with top TC colors
01328         newalstr += HTML_put_table_row(DEFAULTALFOCUSEDEMPHASIS,alentries[tcentries[1]]) + '\n';
01329         // copy remainder of AL
01330         newalstr += alstr.at(alpos,alstr.length()-alpos);
01331         return write_file_from_String(alref,newalstr,"AL");
01332 }

00527                                  {
00528         // Command line interface to search()
00529         // Note: For optimal use, wrap the output of this call in a complete framework
00530         // for an HTML file. It is also possible to direct the error output to another
00531         // file and to link to that one from the HTML file with the search results.
00532         const BigRegex trx("@[^/]+@$");
00533         const BigRegex rrx("\\(^[Hh][Tt][Tt][Pp]:\\|^[Ff][Tt][Pp]:\\)");
00534         if (grepinfo.empty()) {
00535                 EOUT << "dil2al: Missing search information in search_cmd()\n";
00536                 return false;
00537         }
00538         char separator = grepinfo[0];
00539         grepinfo.gsub(replicate(separator,2),(char) 255); // temporarily replace escaped characters
00540         int keyend = grepinfo.index(separator,1);
00541         if (keyend<0) {
00542                 EOUT << "dil2al: Missing search key end in search_cmd()\n";
00543                 return false;
00544         }
00545         if (keyend==1) {
00546                 EOUT << "dil2al: Zero length search key in search_cmd()\n";
00547                 return false;
00548         }
00549         if ((keyend+1)>=grepinfo.length()) {
00550                 EOUT << "dil2al: Missing search target in search_cmd()\n";
00551                 return false;
00552         }
00553         // put all search targets into a StringList
00554         String searchkey(grepinfo.at(1,keyend-1)); searchkey.gsub((char) 255,separator); // restore escaped characters
00555         StringList targets;
00556         grepinfo.del(0,keyend+1);
00557         for (unsigned long i = 0; (!grepinfo.empty()); i++) {
00558                 // get next target from command line arguments
00559                 targets[i] = grepinfo.before(separator);
00560                 if (targets[i].empty()) targets[i] = grepinfo;
00561                 targets[i].gsub((char) 255,separator); // restore escaped characters
00562                 // interpret target
00563                 // *** add: tar(gz) and zip archives, archive declarator, file containing target lines, default set
00564                 if (targets[i].contains(trx)) i = Get_Target_Regex(targets,i,targets[i]) - 1;
00565                 // *** does not yet properly handle remote files matching regex pattern or remote files pointing to archives
00566                 // Now handled within search: else if (file_is_directory(targets[i])) i = Get_Target_Directory(targets,i,targets[i]) - 1;
00567                 else if ((!targets[i].contains(rrx)) && (file_is_directory(targets[i])) && (followlinks<=0)) { // follow links one deep into the directory
00568                         followlinks = 1;
00569                         if (verbose) VOUT << "(Setting followlinks=1 to search directory.)\n";
00570                 }
00571                 grepinfo = grepinfo.after(separator);
00572         }
00573         VOUT << '\n';
00574         String res = search(targets,searchkey,false);
00575         VOUT << "(Number of search results: <B>" << res << "</B>)\n<P>\n";
00576         return true;
00577 }

00164 // the most recent section of the Task Log
00165 // newchunk indicates if a new chunk or a new entry is being prepared
00166 // if newalref is not "" then use it as AL for default/quick choices
00167 // return value "*<DIL-ref>"=same as chunk, "!<DIL-ref>"=non-DIL identifying
00168 // comment, "*"=decision postponed (see variableAL), ""=error

00170 // when newchunk=true the default is the same as that of the current chunk

00186                         return String("");

00189         }

00191         // TC is significantly earlier than the current time
00192         String curALstr;

00205                                 //     should apply only to the recomputation of the AL in stop_TL_chunk()
00206                                 //     above.
00207                                 switch (alautoupdate) {

00210                                                 break;
00211                                         case AAU_ASK:
00212                                                 if (confirmation("AL desynchronized, update now? (y/N) ",'y')) break;
00213                                         default:
