00228                         //     smaller than the suggested start time of the AL, e.g.
00229                         //     if all suggested TCs for this AL day have been completed
00230                 } else EOUT << "Day row missing at top of AL " << curAL << " in select_TL_DIL_refs(), continuing as is\n";
00231         }
00232         // some options from high priority current AL items
00233         if (curALstr.length()>0) {
00234                 int cellindex = 0; String cellparameters, cellcontent;
00235                 while ((numdiloptions<6) && ((cellindex=HTML_get_table_cell(curALstr,cellindex,cellparameters,cellcontent))>=0))

00237                                 diloptions[numdiloptions]=cellcontent;
00238                                 String idhreftext;
00239                                 if (HTML_get_href(cellcontent,0,cellparameters,idhreftext)>=0) {
00240                                         // only unique DIL options
00241                                         for (int i=0; i<numdiloptions; i++) if (diloptions[i].contains(idhreftext)) { cellparameters=""; break; }
00242                                         if (cellparameters.length()>0) {
00243                                                 diloptions[numdiloptions]=cellparameters+':'+cellcontent.after(BigRegex("[]]\n?"));
00244                                                 HTML_remove_tags(diloptions[numdiloptions]);
00245                                                 remove_whitespace(diloptions[numdiloptions]);
00246                                                 if (diloptions[numdiloptions]!="") numdiloptions++;
00247                                         }
00248                                 } else EOUT << "Missing DIL entry reference in AL " << curAL << " in select_TL_DIL_refs(), continuing\n";
00249                         }
00250         }
00251         // some options from recent DIL refs in TL
00252         BigRegex r("[<]!-- \\(chunk\\|entry\\) Context --[>]\\([^\n][^(]*\\)(");
00253         int pos = tl.length(), matchlen;

00255 #ifdef VERBOSEDEBUG
00256                 cout << "Context...\n";
00257 #endif
00258                 int subpos;

00260                         diloptions[numdiloptions] = tl.at(subpos,matchlen);
00261 #ifdef VERBOSEDEBUG
00262                         cout << "Candidate Context from TL: " << diloptions[numdiloptions] << '\n';
00263 #endif
00264                         String idhrefname = diloptions[numdiloptions].at(BigRegex("#[0-9]+[.][0-9]+"));
00265                         // only unique DIL options
00266                         for (int i=0; i<numdiloptions; i++) if (diloptions[i].contains(idhrefname)) { idhrefname=""; break; }
00267                         if (idhrefname!="") {
00268                                 diloptions[numdiloptions].del(BigRegex("[<]A [^>]*[Hh][Rr][Ee][Ff][     ]*=[^\"]*\""));
00269                                 diloptions[numdiloptions].gsub("\">",":");
00270                                 diloptions[numdiloptions].del(BigRegex("\\([<][^>]*[>]\\)?[     ]*("));
00271                                 if (diloptions[numdiloptions]!="") numdiloptions++;
00272                         }
00273                 }
00274         }

00276         if (askALDILref) {
00277                 String affiliation = "";
00278                 while (affiliation=="") {
00279                         if (useansi) cout << ANSI_UNDERLINE_ON; // underline on
00280                         if (newchunk) cout << "\nChunk "; else cout << "\nEntry ";

00282                         if (useansi) cout << ANSI_UNDERLINE_OFF; // underline off
00283                         for (int i=1; i<numdiloptions; i++) cout << i << ". " << diloptions[i] << '\n';
00284                         if (useansi) cout << ANSI_BOLD_ON; // bold on

00287                         if (useansi) cout << ANSI_BOLD_OFF; // bold off
00288                         cin.getline(lbuf,LLEN);
00289                         if (lbuf[0]!='\0') {
00290                                 affiliation = lbuf;
00291                                 if (affiliation.matches(BRXint)) { // quick-select menu item
00292                                         int q = atoi((const char *) affiliation);
00293                                         if ((q>0) && (q<numdiloptions)) affiliation = diloptions[q].before(":");
00294                                         else {
00295                                                 EOUT << "dil2al: Selection " << q << " is not a predefined DIL reference option\n";
00296                                                 affiliation = "";
00297                                         }
00298                                 } else if (affiliation.matches(BRXdouble)) { // DIL ID
00299                                         ifstream dbid(idfile);
00300                                         if (!dbid) {
00301                                                 EOUT << "dil2al: Unable to read " << idfile << " in select_TL_DIL_ref()\n";
00302                                                 return String("");
00303                                         }
00304                                         affiliation.prepend("#");
00305 #ifdef DEBUG
00306                                         cout << "seeking " << affiliation << '\n';
00307 #endif
00308                                         if (find_line(&dbid,affiliation,lbuf,LLEN)) {
00309                                                 affiliation = lbuf;
00310                                                 affiliation.del(BigRegex("[^<]*[<]TD[^>]*[>][<]A[^>]*[Hh][Rr][Ee][Ff]=\""));
00311                                                 affiliation = affiliation.before("\"");

00313                                         cout << "exists: " << affiliation << '\n';
00314 #endif
00315                                         } else {
00316                                                 EOUT << "dil2al: DIL reference " << affiliation << " not found in " << idfile << '\n';
00317                                                 affiliation = "";
00318                                         }
00319                                         dbid.close();
00320                                 } else if (affiliation=="?") {
00321                                         if (system(browser+" "+curAL)<0) EOUT << "dil2al: Unable to browse in select_TL_DIL_refs(), continuing\n";
00322                                         affiliation = "";

00324                                         if (drf) {
00325                                                 if (find_line(&drf,"Current URL",lbuf,LLEN)) {
00326                                                         String urlline = lbuf;

00328                                                         if (lbuf[0]==' ') urlline += lbuf;
00329                                                         urlline.del("Current URL");
00330                                                         urlline.del("file://");

00332                                                         urlline.del(basedir+RELLISTSDIR);
00333                                                         if (useansi) cout << ANSI_BOLD_ON; // bold on
00334                                                         cout << "Take `" << urlline << "' as DIL reference ID or identifying comment? (y/N)";
00335                                                         if (useansi) cout << ANSI_BOLD_OFF; // bold off
00336                                                         cin.getline(lbuf,LLEN);
00337                                                         if ((lbuf[0]=='y') || (lbuf[0]=='Y')) affiliation=urlline;
00338                                                 }
00339                                                 drf.close();
00340                                                 unlink(dilref);
00341                                         }
00342                                 } else if (affiliation=="?&") {
00343                                         if (system("rxvt -e "+browser+" "+curAL+" &")<0) EOUT << "dil2al: Unable to spawn a browser in select_TL_DIL_refs(), continuing\n";
00344                                         affiliation = "";
00345                                 } else if (affiliation!="*") affiliation.prepend("!"); // else non-DIL identifying comment
00346                         } else {
00347                                 affiliation=diloptions[0].before(":");
00348                                 if (!newchunk) affiliation.prepend("*"); // same as chunk DIL (no entry specific reference required)
00349                         }
00350                 }
00351                 return affiliation;
00352         } else {
00353                 diloptions[0]=diloptions[0].before(":");
00354                 if (!newchunk) diloptions[0].prepend("*");
00355                 return diloptions[0];
00356         }
00357 }

00296         if (substring_from_line("^[     ]*thursdayendwork[      ]*=[    ]*(.+)$",2,confdefs,lbuf)) wdworkendprefs[4] = work_end_preferences(confdefs[1]);
00297         if (substring_from_line("^[     ]*fridayendwork[        ]*=[    ]*(.+)$",2,confdefs,lbuf)) wdworkendprefs[5] = work_end_preferences(confdefs[1]);
00298         if (substring_from_line("^[     ]*saturdayendwork[      ]*=[    ]*(.+)$",2,confdefs,lbuf)) wdworkendprefs[6] = work_end_preferences(confdefs[1]);
00299         if (pattern_in_line("^[         ]*usequickloadcache[    ]*",lbuf)) usequickloadcache=true;
00300         if (pattern_in_line("^[         ]*nousequickloadcache[  ]*",lbuf)) usequickloadcache=false;
00301         if (pattern_in_line("^[         ]*reversehierarchy[     ]*",lbuf)) reversehierarchy=true;

01493 // by appending "<!-- " to the head code.
01494 // Note that since standard output does not know which file the text may
01495 // be embedded in, HREF file references are absolute. Post-processing may
01496 // convert those to relative references.
01497 // This output presents FORM check boxes and a "submit" button that extracts
01498 // checked DIL IDs with the aid of dil2al form processing.

01500 // the top items in new hierarchies to visualize.

00307                                                                       {
00308 // corrections applied to a generated TeX text
00309 // rather than assuming a plain text source as above, this function assumes
00310 // a TeX draft
00311         const BigRegex TeXerr_refrx("\\\\\\\(ref\\|cite\\)\\([{]\\)[^}]*\\([{\\]\\)");
00312         const BigRegex TeXnon_refrx("[^-0-9A-Za-z:._+]");
00313         const BigRegex TeXnon_citerx("[^-0-9A-Za-z:._+,]");
00314         const BigRegex TeXerr_reflblrx("\\\\ref[{]\\([^}]*[^-0-9A-Za-z:._+}][^}]*\\)[}]");
00315         const BigRegex TeXerr_citelblrx("\\\\cite[{]\\([^}]*[^-0-9A-Za-z:._+,}][^}]*\\)[}]");
00316         const BigRegex TeXfighererx("\\\\[A-za-z]*figurehere");
00317         int i,j,k; String movestr, reststr;
00318         // a) \ref{ \command[]{}{} } or \ref{ {  } } or \cite{ \command[]{}{} } or \cite{ {  } }
00319         while ((i=ostrtext.index(TeXerr_refrx))>=0) { // iteratively applied to the whole text
00320                 if ((k=TeX_get_command(ostrtext,i,reststr))>=0) {
00321                         switch (ostrtext.elem(TeXerr_refrx.subpos(3))) {
00322                                 case '\\': // move interfering command after \ref{} or \cite{}
00323                                         if ((j=TeX_get_command(ostrtext,TeXerr_refrx.subpos(3),movestr))>=0) {
00324                                                 reststr = ostrtext.at(j,k-j)+movestr+ostrtext.from(k);
00325                                                 ostrtext = ostrtext.before(TeXerr_refrx.subpos(3));
00326                                                 ostrtext += reststr;
00327                                                 if (verbose) VOUT << "TeX Correction: Moved TeX command out of " << String(ostrtext.at(i,(k-movestr.length())-i)) << '\n';
00328                                         } else { // loose `\'
00329                                                 ostrtext[TeXerr_refrx.subpos(3)] = '-';
00330                                                 if (verbose) VOUT << "TeX Correction: Changed `\\' to `-' in " << String(ostrtext.at(i,k-i)) << '\n';
00331                                         }
00332                                         break;
00333                                 case '{': // move interfereing scope after \ref{} or \cite{}
00334                                         if ((j=TeX_get_scope(ostrtext,TeXerr_refrx.subpos(3),movestr))>=0) {
00335                                                 reststr = ostrtext.at(j,k-j)+'{'+movestr+'}'+ostrtext.from(k);
00336                                                 ostrtext = ostrtext.before(TeXerr_refrx.subpos(3));
00337                                                 ostrtext += reststr;
00338                                                 if (verbose) VOUT << "TeX Correction: Moved TeX scope out of " << String(ostrtext.at(i,(k-(movestr.length()+2))-i)) << '\n';
00339                                         } else { // loose `{'
00340                                                 ostrtext[TeXerr_refrx.subpos(3)] = '+';
00341                                                 if (verbose) VOUT << "TeX Correction: Changed `{' to `+' in " << String(ostrtext.at(i,k-i)) << '\n';
00342                                         }
00343                                         break;
00344                         }
00345                 } else { // missing `}'
00346                         if ((j=ostrtext.index(TeXnon_refrx,TeXerr_refrx.subpos(2)+1))>=0) {
00347                                 reststr = ostrtext.from(j);
00348                                 ostrtext = ostrtext.before(j);
00349                                 ostrtext += '}' + reststr;
00350                         } else ostrtext += '}';
00351                         if (verbose) VOUT << "TeX Correction: Added missing } for " << String(ostrtext.at(i,j-i)) << '\n';
00352                 }
00353         }
00354         // b) \ref{ non-label-characters }
00355         i = 0;
00356         while ((i=ostrtext.index(TeXerr_reflblrx,i))>=0) { // single pass
00357                 movestr = ostrtext.sub(TeXerr_reflblrx,1);
00358                 movestr.gsub(TeXnon_refrx,"X");
00359                 if (verbose) VOUT << "TeX Correction: Changed non-label characters to `X' in \\ref{" << movestr << "}\n";
00360                 if (estimate) { // attempt to estimate the intended reference label
00361                         j = 0; String argstr;
00362                         while ((j=ostrtext.index(TeXfighererx,String::SEARCH_END,j))>=0) {
00363                                 if ((k=TeX_get_argument(ostrtext,j,argstr,'{'))>=0) {
00364                                         if ((k=TeX_get_argument(ostrtext,k,argstr,'{'))>=0) {
00365                                                 if (movestr.matches(BigRegex("X*"+RX_Search_Safe(argstr)+"X*"))) {
00366                                                         if (verbose) VOUT << "TeX Correction: Assuming that \\ref{" << movestr << "} actually refers to ``" << argstr << "''\n";
00367                                                         movestr = argstr;
00368                                                         break;
00369                                                 }
00370                                                 j = k;
00371                                         }
00372                                 }
00373                         }
00374                         
00375                 }
00376                 ostrtext.at(TeXerr_reflblrx.subpos(1),TeXerr_reflblrx.sublen(1)) = movestr;
00377         }
00378         // c) \cite{ non-label-characters }
00379         // *** can compare with all known bibliography keys
00380         i = 0;
00381         while ((i=ostrtext.index(TeXerr_citelblrx,i))>=0) { // single pass
00382                 movestr = ostrtext.sub(TeXerr_citelblrx,1);
00383                 movestr.gsub(TeXnon_citerx,"X");
00384                 if (verbose) VOUT << "TeX Correction: Changed non-label characters to `X' in \\cite{" << movestr << "}\n";
00385                 ostrtext.at(TeXerr_citelblrx.subpos(1),TeXerr_citelblrx.sublen(1)) = movestr;
00386         }
00387 }

int TeX_get_command (  String &    textstr,
int    start,
String &    cmdstr
) 
 

Definition at line 229 of file ppfilter.cc.

References String::at(), String::matches(), BigRegex::sublen(), BigRegex::subpos(), and TeX_get_argument().

Referenced by extract_paper_plan_to_paper(), and TeX_format_corrections(). 

00229                                                                   {
00230 // get command and arguments text (\command[]{}{}{}{}{}{}{}{}) at start
00231 // returns location
00232 // *** if you need function that find commands or other chunks after rather than
00233 //     at a certain location, in the same manner as the HTML utilities, then
00234 //     either add a paramter that controls such an option, or create wrapper
00235 //     functions that search for a chunk and then call these functions
00236         const BigRegex TeXcmd("\\(\\\\[A-Za-z]+\\).*"); // TeX command identifier
00237         if (!textstr.matches(TeXcmd,start)) return -1;
00238         // get command
00239         int cend = TeXcmd.subpos(1)+TeXcmd.sublen(1);
00240         String argstr; int argstart, j, argsleft = 9;
00241         // find possible optional argument
00242         if ((j=TeX_get_argument(textstr,cend,argstr,'['))>=0) {
00243                 cend = j; argsleft--;
00244         }
00245         // find and convert possible mandatory arguments
00246         while ((argsleft>0) && ((j=TeX_get_argument(textstr,cend,argstr,'{'))>=0)) {
00247                 cend = j; argsleft--;
00248         }
00249         cmdstr = textstr.at(start,cend-start);
00250         return cend;
00251 }

int TeX_get_scope (  String &    textstr,
int    start,
String &    scopecontent
) 
 

Definition at line 195 of file ppfilter.cc.

References String::at(), String::elem(), and String::index().

Referenced by TeX_format_corrections(), TeX_get_argument(), and TeX_safe_text(). 

00195                                                                       {
00196 // get the text between brackets starting at start
00197 // returns location after closing bracket or -1 if there is no closing bracket
00198         const BigRegex brck1rx("[\\{\\}]"); // \\{ rather than { because of regex-gnu.h/BigRegex.hh setting
00199         const BigRegex brck2rx("[][]");
00200         const BigRegex brck3rx("[()]");
00201         const BigRegex * brckrx;
00202         char bracket = textstr.elem(start);
00203         switch (bracket) {
00204                 case '{': brckrx = &brck1rx; break;
00205                 case '[': brckrx = &brck2rx; break;
00206                 case '(': brckrx = &brck3rx; break;
00207         }
00208         int depth = 1, i = start+1;
00209         while ((depth>0) && ((i=textstr.index(*brckrx,i))>=0)) {
00210                 if (i>0) if (textstr.elem(i-1)=='\\') { i++; continue; } // escaped bracket
00211                 if (textstr.elem(i)==bracket) depth++; else depth--;
00212                 i++;
00213         }
00214         if (i>=0) scopecontent = textstr.at(start+1,i-(start+2));
00215         return i;
00216 }

String TeX_safe_text (  String &    title ) 
 

Definition at line 253 of file ppfilter.cc.

References String::at(), String::elem(), String::from(), String::gsub(), String::index(), String::matches(), String::sub(), BigRegex::sublen(), TeX_get_argument(), and TeX_get_scope().

Referenced by extract_hierarchy_depth_increase_to_paper(). 

00253                                      {
00254 // produces a version of title in proper TeX format from plain text
00255 // no attempt is made to convert '\', since it is assumed to precede
00256 // TeX commands that are frequently embedded in notes
00257 // there are two forms of recognized embedded TeX bracketing:
00258 // (1) foo\somecommand [text0] {text1} {text2} {text3} bar (with optional space)
00259 // (2) foo{\somecommand text}bar
00260 // all other curly brackets and hanging curly brackets are converted
00261         const BigRegex TeXchar("[#$%&_]"); // TeX special characters
00262         const BigRegex TeXcmdctx("[\\{}]"); // TeX command context indicators
00263         const BigRegex TeXcmd("\\(\\\\[A-Za-z]+\\).*"); // TeX command identifier
00264         const BigRegex TeXscopecmd("{[ \n\t\r\v\f]*\\\\[A-Za-z]+.*"); // TeX scope limited command identification
00265         int convertedto = 0, i = 0;
00266         String convtitle;
00267         while ((i=title.index(TeXcmdctx,convertedto))>=0) {
00268                 convtitle += title.at(convertedto,i-convertedto);
00269                 switch (title.elem(i)) {
00270                         case '\\': if (title.matches(TeXcmd,i)) {
00271                                         // find and convert command
00272                                         convtitle += title.sub(TeXcmd,1);
00273                                         convertedto = i + TeXcmd.sublen(1);
00274                                         String argstr; int argstart, j, argsleft = 9;
00275                                         // find and convert possible optional argument
00276                                         if ((j=TeX_get_argument(title,convertedto,argstr,'[',&argstart))>=0) {
00277                                                 convtitle += title.at(convertedto,argstart-convertedto) + '[' + TeX_safe_text(argstr) + ']';
00278                                                 convertedto = j; argsleft--;
00279                                         }
00280                                         // find and convert possible mandatory arguments
00281                                         while ((argsleft>0) && ((j=TeX_get_argument(title,convertedto,argstr,'{',&argstart))>=0)) {
00282                                                 convtitle += title.at(convertedto,argstart-convertedto) + '{' + TeX_safe_text(argstr) + '}';
00283                                                 convertedto = j; argsleft--;
00284                                         }
00285                                 } else {
00286                                         convtitle += "$\\backslash$"; convertedto = i+1;
00287                                 } break;
00288                         case '{': if (title.matches(TeXscopecmd,i)) {
00289                                         String scopecontent;
00290                                         int j = TeX_get_scope(title,i,scopecontent);
00291                                         if (j<0) {
00292                                                 convtitle += "\\{"; convertedto = i+1;
00293                                         } else {
00294                                                 convtitle += '{' + TeX_safe_text(scopecontent) + '}'; convertedto = j;
00295                                         }
00296                                 } else {
00297                                         convtitle += "\\{"; convertedto = i+1;
00298                                 } break;
00299                         case '}': convtitle += "\\}"; convertedto = i+1; break;
00300                 }
00301         }
00302         convtitle += title.from(convertedto);
00303         convtitle.gsub(TeXchar,"\\_0",'_');
00304         return convtitle;
00305 }

00849                                                                                                                                                                        {
00850   // update the elements of all instances of dilid, as
00851   // referenced in the DIL-by-ID file
00852   // When tdiff>=0, this is used to indicate new time spent on the DIL
00853   // entry during a task chunk instead of the value in completion.
00854   // The simplest update uses the difference between current time
00855   // and the start time of the most recent task log chunk to compute
00856   // the update. More sophisticated updates apply the rules
00857   // specified in dil2al.html#20000815153735.1.
00858   // get DIL references of DIL entry
00859   Detailed_Items_List dilist; int entrynum;
00860   if ((entrynum=dilist.Get_All_DIL_ID_File_Parameters(&dilid))<=0) {
00861     EOUT << "DIL entry " << dilid << " not found in " << idfile << " in update_DIL_entry_completion_ratio(), continuing as is\n";
00862     return false;
00863   }
00864   if (entrynum>1) VOUT << "Warning - DIL entry with ID " << dilid << " occurs " << entrynum << " times in " << idfile << '\n';
00865   DIL_entry * de = dilist.list.head(); int dilidx;
00866   PLL_LOOP_FORWARD(DIL_Topical_List,de->Topics(0),1) {
00867     // get DIL file and update completion ratio of entry
00868     if ((dilidx=get_file_in_list(e->dil.file,dilist.tf,dilist.tfname,dilist.tfnum))<0)
00869       EOUT << "dil2al: DIL file " << e->dil.file << " not found in update_DIL_entry_elements(), continuing as is\n";
00870     else {
00871       // find DIL ID
00872       String & dilstr = dilist.tf[dilidx];
00873       int dilpos, dilentryend; String cellparams, cellcontent;
00874       if ((dilpos=dilstr.index(BigRegex("[<]!--[        ]*dil2al:[      ]*DIL begin[    ]*--[>]"),String::SEARCH_END))<0) {
00875         EOUT << "dil2al: Missing DIL begin marker in DIL file " << e->dil.file << " in update_DIL_entry_elements(), continuing as is\n";
00876         continue;
00877       }
00878       if ((dilpos=dilstr.index(BigRegex(("[<][Aa][      ]+[Nn][Aa][Mm][Ee][     ]*=[    ]*\""+RX_Search_Safe(dilid))+'"'),dilpos))<0) {
00879         EOUT << "dil2al: DIL entry with ID " << dilid << " not found in DIL file " << e->dil.file << " in update_DIL_entry_elements(), continuing as is\n";
00880         continue;
00881       }
00882       if ((dilentryend=HTML_get_table_cell(dilstr,dilpos,cellparams,cellcontent,&dilpos))<0) {
00883         EOUT << "dil2al: Missing data at DIL entry with ID " << dilid << " in DIL file " << e->dil.file << " in update_DIL_entry_elements(), continuing as is\n";
00884         continue;
00885       }
00886       if (verbose) VOUT << "Setting:\n";
00887       if (updateval) { // modify valuation
00888         String vstr(valuation,"_1 %4.2f");
00889         if (verbose) VOUT << "  valuation = " << vstr << '\n';
00890         cellcontent.gsub(BigRegex("\\(valuation:[^-0-9  ]*\\)[  ]*\\([0-9]+[.][0-9]+\\|-\\)"),vstr,'_');
00891       }
00892       if (updatecomp) { // modify completion ratio
00893         String crstr;
00894         if (tdiff>=0) {
00895           if (!updatereq) {
00896             cellparams = cellcontent.after(BigRegex("time[      ]+required[^:   ]*[:    ]")); HTML_remove_tags(cellparams);
00897             required = atof(cellparams);
00898           }
00899           crstr = cellparams.after(BigRegex("completion[        ]+ratio[^:      ]*[:    ]"));
00900           completion = atof(crstr);
00901           if (completion<0.0) EOUT << "dil2al: DIL entry with ID " << dilid << " in DIL file " << e->dil.file << " has a completion status with special meaning that cannot be updated in update_DIL_entry_elements(), continuing as is\n";
00902           else {
00903             if (required==0.0) EOUT << "dil2al: No time required indicated for DIL entry with ID " << dilid << " in DIL file " << e->dil.file << " in update_DIL_entry_elements(), continuing as is\n";
00904             else completion += (((double) tdiff)/(ceil(required*60.0)*60.0));
00905           }
00906         }
00907         crstr = String(completion,"_1 %4.2f");
00908         if (verbose) VOUT << "  completion ratio = " << crstr << '\n';
00909         cellcontent.gsub(BigRegex("\\(completion[       ]+ratio:[^-0-9  ]*\\)[  ]*\\([0-9]+[.][0-9]+\\|-\\)"),crstr,'_');
00910       }
00911       if (updatereq) { // modify required time
00912         String rstr(required,"_1 %4.2f");
00913         if (verbose) VOUT << "  required = " << rstr << '\n';
00914         cellcontent.gsub(BigRegex("\\(time[     ]+required:[^-0-9       ]*\\)[  ]*\\([0-9]+[.][0-9]+\\|-\\)"),rstr,'_');
00915       }
00916       // paste modified DIL entry into topical DIL file
00917       String newdilstr(dilstr.before(dilpos));
00918       newdilstr += HTML_put_table_cell("",cellcontent,true) + dilstr.from(dilentryend);
00919       // write modified DIL file
00920       if (!write_file_from_String(e->dil.file,newdilstr,"DIL ``"+e->dil.title+"''")) return false;
00921     }
00922   }
00923 #ifdef DEBUG
00924   EOUT << "Completed DIL updates\n";
00925 #endif
00926   return true;
00927 }

bool update_DIL_entry_parameter_elements (  Detailed_Items_List &    dilist,

00931   // target date modification is currently a special case, as described in
00932   // the modify_DIL_entry_target_date() and modify_DIL_group_target_dates()
00933   // and is therefore not included in this function
00934   int entrynum = dilist.list.length();

00936   DIL_entry * de = dilist.list.head()->elbyid(dilid);
00937   if (!de) {

00944     if (!de->parameters) {

00952     }
00953   }
00954   // Remove superiors indicated in removesups
00955   if ((removesupsnum>0) && (removesups)) {
00956     if (verbose) {
00957       VOUT << "Removing superior references:\n";
00958       for (int i = 0; i<removesupsnum; i++) VOUT << "     " << (*removesups)[i] << '\n';
00959     }
00960     // modify project data to remove the superiors
00961     if (!de->Projects(0)) {
00962       VOUT << "The DIL entry with ID " << dilid.chars() << " has no superiors, therefore none can be removed.\n";
00963       return false;
00964     }
00965     for (int i = 0; i<removesupsnum; i++) {
00966       PLL_LOOP_FORWARD(DIL_Superiors,de->Projects(0),1) if (e->al.title==(*removesups)[i]) {
00967         e->remove();
00968         if (verbose) VOUT << "     " << (*removesups)[i] << " removed\n";
00969         break;
00970       }
00971     }
00972   }
00973   return dilist.Write_to_File();
00974 }

String URI_unescape (  String    escapedURI ) 
 

Definition at line 2644 of file utilities.cc.

References String::length().

Referenced by extract_DIL_IDs_from_form(), search_FORM_cmd(), and Tabbed_FORM_DIL_Hierarchy_full(). 

02644                                        {
02645 // convert URI strings with escaped characters to regular character strings
02646         String s; char c; int d1,d2;
02647         for (int i = 0; i<escapedURI.length(); i++) {
02648                 c = escapedURI[i];
02649                 if (c=='%') {
02650                         i++; c = escapedURI[i];
02651                         if ((c>='0') && (c<='9')) d1 = (int) (c - '0');
02652                         else if ((c>='A') && (c<='F')) d1 = ((int) (c - 'A')) + 10;
02653                         else d1 = ((int) (c - 'a')) + 10;
02654                         i++; c = escapedURI[i];
02655                         if ((c>='0') && (c<='9')) d2 = (int) (c - '0');
02656                         else if ((c>='A') && (c<='F')) d2 = ((int) (c - 'A')) + 10;
02657                         else d2 = ((int) (c - 'a')) + 10;
02658                         d1 *=16; d1 += d2;
02659                         c = (char) d1;
02660                 }
02661                 s += c;
02662         }
02663         return s;
02664 }

02118 // a previous version (if one exists).
02119 #ifdef DEBUG

02121         if (b) cout << '+';

02133         if (b) cout << '+';
02134 #endif
02135         if (isnew) { if (verbose && (!message.empty())) VOUT << message << " initialized as " << filename << '\n'; }
02136         else if (!backup_and_rename(filename,message)) return false;
02137 #ifdef DEBUG

02139 #endif
02140         return true;
